documentation.text:
@notice Contract registering written laws. 
 @dev Laws can be edited (add, remove) by address contained in {Register_Authorities} list (Defined in the "Register" inherited contract)
@dev Mapping of All registered in the contract (No matter which Law they belong to). The key is the keccak256 hash of it's Title and Content field.
@dev Mapping of all Laws registered in the contract. The key is a bytes corresponding to the Title of the Law. The title can be clear or hashed.
@dev List of all laws of registered in the contract.

@dev Add the address of Agora Contract to {Register_Authorities}.
 
 @param agora Address of Agora contract

devdoc.details: Laws can be edited (add, remove) by address contained in {Register_Authorities} list (Defined in the "Register" inherited contract)

AddArticle(bytes,bytes,bytes).details: The ID of an article is the keccak256 hash of it's title and it's content. So (Article_Title, Content) tutple is the ID of the article and have to be unique among all registered Articles.

params.Law_Title: Title of the law we want to add a new article. The corresponding law must exist.

AddLaw(bytes,bytes).details: Parameters can be hashed! The new law is added to {Lois} mapping and to {List_Lois} array.

params.Description: Text explaining the aim of the law
params.Title: title of the law. It's the ID of the law

Change_Law_Description(bytes,bytes).details: We can't change the "Title" field of the Law as it's his ID

Get_Law_Article_List(bytes).details: Return the list of all articles contained by a specific law

params.law: Title of the law from which we want to get all Articles.

returns.law_article_list: Array of all articles ID of a law

Get_Law_Info(bytes).details: Return informations about a specific law.

params.law: Title of the law from which we want to get Infos.

Get_Law_List().details: Return the list of all laws's titles registered in the contract

returns.list_lois: Array of of all registered laws's titles

Remove_Article(bytes,bytes32).details: The Article is deleted from {Articles} mapping and from corresponding Law {List_Articles} List field

params.Law_Title: Title of the Law from which we want to remove an Article
params.article: Hash ID of the article to remove

Remove_Law(bytes).details: All Articles of the law are deleted from {Articles} mapping. The Law is deleted from {List_Lois} mapping and from {Lois} Array.

params.law: Title of the Law we want to remove

Set_Constitution(address).details: The function Allows to change the Constitution contract the current Institution obey to. The function is only callable by the {Constitution_Address}

params.new_constitution: Address of the new Constitution contract.

constructor.details: Add the address of Agora Contract to {Register_Authorities}.

Articles.details: Mapping of All registered in the contract (No matter which Law they belong to). The key is the keccak256 hash of it's Title and Content field.

List_Lois.details: List of all laws of registered in the contract.

Lois.details: Mapping of all Laws registered in the contract. The key is a bytes corresponding to the Title of the Law. The title can be clear or hashed.

AddArticle(bytes,bytes,bytes).notice: Add a new article to an existing law

AddLaw(bytes,bytes).notice: Add a new law to the register

Change_Law_Description(bytes,bytes).notice: Change the Description of an existing law

Constitution_Address().notice: Address of the constitution of the DAO

Remove_Article(bytes,bytes32).notice: Remove an article from a law

Remove_Authority(address).notice: Removes an account address from the {Register_Authorities}
